data.title: VOA Tour: WLW - world's most powerful radio station
data.meta_description: From April 17, 1934 until sometime in 1939, WLW was the world's most powerful radio station, broadcasting with half a million watts power. In 1939 the FCC mandated that its power be reduced back to its former (and current) 50 Killowatts.
data.text: From April 17, 1934 until sometime in 1939, WLW was the world's most powerful radio station, broadcasting with half a million watts power. In 1939 the FCC mandated that its power be reduced back to its former (and current) 50 Killowatts.
